intro: Ruellia verbasciformis, commonly known as the woolly bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and clusters of small, sky-blue to lavender flowers. The plant belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shaded areas. Ruellia verbasciformis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade. Its flowering period typically occurs in the spring and early summer.
